subject: control: action to override a single fan in a zone - Action class
commitMessage:
control: action to override a single fan in a zone - Action class

This change contains the OverrideFanTarget class to create the Action
from a json config. A very basic events.json would look like this:

[
  {
    "name": "test",
    "groups": [
      { "name": "fan0 sensor inventory", "interface": "xyz.openbmc_project.State.Decorator.OperationalStatus",
      "property": { "name": "Functional" } }
    ],
    "triggers": [
      { "class": "init", "method": "get_properties" },
      { "class": "signal", "signal": "properties_changed" }
    ],
    "actions": [ {
      "name": "override_fan_target",
      "count": 1,
      "state": false,
      "fans": [ "fan0", "fan2" ],
      "target": 9999
    } ]
  }
]

When the tach sensor for fan0 is set to non-funtional:

root@p10bmc:~# busctl set-property xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Manager
  /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard/fan0/fan0_0
  xyz.openbmc_project.State.Decorator.OperationalStatus Functional b false

the run() method for the Action is called and all registered fans will
be locked at the "target" value given in the json "actions" section.

...
<output trimmed>
...
 FAN        TARGET(RPM)  FEEDBACKS(RPMS)   PRESENT   FUNCTIONAL
===============================================================
 fan0              9999       7019/9999      true         true
 fan1             10000       7020/10000     true         true
 fan2              9999       7019/9999      true         true
...

When the inventory registers the sensor back to functional, the override
lock is lifted and the fan is restored to its zone's current target.

Signed-off-by: Mike Capps <mikepcapps@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6bf5bd55fd6eac2131aec02775a64ad287d3b3b0

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 59af8caa3c07db908e5a6fe8b3c5f4dbeead8959
this check prevents unnecessary unlocking on startup
Done
You could use the new record() function I added into the Action base class to log when you're locking and unlocking to the flight recorder, I think that would be helpful.
Done
the fan is restored to its zone's current target.
Done
Doesnt appear to be currently used, however it should be to handle if more than one instance of this action against the same fan could exist across events.
Ack
This should be put in its own function since its a required JSON entry and should throw an ActionParseError if its not there.
Done

This can be greatly simplified if the result of bool `(numAtState >= _count)` was given to the zone's function to determine whether to lock or unlock a fan.

Also, the `goto` isnt necessary since breaking out of the loop once the numAtState >= _count can be done, even if that check is done twice (once for the inner loop and once for the outer loop).

Does this not work when recording to the flight recorder?
```
record("Zone fans unlocked");
```
Ack - fix will be deferred into next commit
Action to override fan targets
Done

This is a configuration specific statement, instead a description of how this action class works by checking groups against the configured state and when the given `count` or more are at that state, the given fans are locked at a given target.

This is also a good place to put an example JSON config using this action and writing up an associated description.
Done
remove
Done

Aren't the fans given, locked at the configured target?

Maybe just remove this since the next sentence correctly describes what happens.
Done

I didnt see your updates in the zone and/or fan objects use an instance id, which I think they should have since you could have more than one event locking a fan speed based on different triggers.

Then the highest fan lock target should always be used if there's more than one. Once that is unlocked, if another lock on the same fan exists from a different event, the next highest lock target is used...once no other locks exist, the fan should return to its zone's current target.
Ack, I am addressing the easy comments first and the multi-lock functionality will come in a subsequent commit.
This should not keep track of any lock state as this is determined each time the action is run.
Done
When the unlock condition is detected you need to know if the action was in the locked state.
Please add comment for what this is for.
Done
Done

Did you find this helps in efficiency for the different types of triggers that could be used on this action? It seems maybe this is just saving the finding of the fan on the zone when this action would be triggered and the fans are already unlocked?
I dont understand the question. let's discuss offline.
Done

This should reflect that the a lock is requested to the fans on the zone since they may not be locked to the target given here.

Also, can this get enhanced with the zone name, fan names, and requested lock target value that is requested?
Do you think the fan names are actually required? If the zones are named properly I think it would be a much easier to read the diagnostic message.
Ok, its fine to use the zone name.
Same here as noted in lockFans()
Done
This may not be true since there could be other reasons a fan is still locked.
The bool does not represent the locked state of fans. It is a logical aid to manage the state of the OverrideFanTarget action.
Done
2022 (now that I finally got around to looking at it...sorry)
Done
odd wrapping
Done
I dont understand this comment. State the members must be at to lock fans at the given target?
Done
I dont believe this should be needed since the locked state can be determined from the count right?
The locks are held by the Fan objects, there's no easily accessible count of locks. But I did notice it is not being initialized so I've fixed that.
But there can be a count from within this action since this `_locked` is only specific to if this instance of the action requested a lock.

Probably should re-word this since there could be other locks already in place by other actions.

"Adding fan target lock of " + std::to_string(_target) + "on zone " + zone.getName()
Done

... "... on zone " zone.getName());

`getUniqueName()` is the action's name, not the zone's name.
